page.title: 05EAST KNIGHTON
page.content: The heath was renamed'Egdon Heath'by the novelist Thomas Hardy,and used as a setting in his novel'The Return of the Native'.Gustav Holst visited Hardy and was so impressed by the heath that he composed a piece of music that he named 'Egdon Heath'. Nestling at the edge of the heath is the hamlet of East Knighton.It consists of groups of houses grouped along mainly unmade up roads.Several of these are thatched and the thatcher has been busy this Summer.The'Rising Sun Inn'stands on the village green,it serves Bar Meals. The 'Rainbow Garage'stands on the main road.People can remember when it was a 'Smithy',the first petrol pump was installed in 1923.It now services cars Nearby at Knoll Cottage there is a residential caravan site,and Wynards Farm has holiday caravans.
